title: A decade since formation, LCSG still hurdled by manpower, decentralization concerns
excerpt: In 2012, DLSU and then-De La Salle Canlubang (DLSC) concerted together a plan to a establish the Science and Technology Complex. This joint effort would curb overpopulation concerns in Taft and advance the science and technology field in a new campus.

title: On the microscale: Women lead USG amid widespread misogyny
excerpt: It may be an understatement to say that the national political scene has not been friendly to women.

title: Is there room for more? Independent candidates challenge DLSU two-party system
excerpt: Last year's make-up elections (MUE) saw the candidacy of five independent coalitions after Santugon sa Tawag no Panahon (Santugon), who had been criticized for alleged red-tagging against rival Alyansang Tapat sa Lasallista (Tapat), opted not to field in candidates, at least under its banner.
